Check with the latest integration build, 1027, there shouldn't be any issue.
So you don't think you should add a defensive check for an NPE?

The exact same line (adjusted for null check and new copyright) is still causing problems in WTP 1.0.2. It can occur during startup of the J2EE plugin which causes it to fail loading and block all J2EE function:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2006-04-17 09:57:31.344
!MESSAGE An error occurred while automatically activating bundle org.eclipse.jst.j2ee (499).
!STACK 0
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.plugin.J2EEPlugin.start() of bundle org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.startActivator(BundleContextImpl.java:1013)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.start(BundleContextImpl.java:969)

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException

	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.extractValue(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:1110)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.primUpdateMOFFeature(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:1352)
	...
Tim, is it random or do you see it everytime, are there any steps to reproduce?

I'm not seeing this myself; it was reported by another user on an early 1.0.2 build. (I checked - this class has not changed since then) I've sent the full logs to your inbox and a workspace is available. We don't know why this one user is hitting this, and no known steps to reproduce. It obviously doesn't happen very often since it hasn't been reported in months, but the result is severe. Restarting the workspace does not fix the problem.
While i can't reproduce the defect, i have added null check in convertStringToValue() where call is made to edit.getContentModelRoot(),  which could return null value
